result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joseph M Standish

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Joseph M Standish in court.  Attorney Benjamin T Van Severen in court for Joseph M Standish.  Attorney Jon R Josephsen Jr. in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for Deferred Prosecution agreement Hearing. 

Parties are prepared to enter into a deferred prosecution agreement.

As to Count 1: Defendant was advised of constitution rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights and entered a plea of GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the guilty plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Complaint/Information.  Court WITHHELD entry of judgment of conviction.  Deferred Prosecution Agreement received, signed and filed.
 
Court ordered case adjourned for Review in Branch 17.
Review hearing scheduled for November 29, 2022 at 02:45 pm.
Received and Filed. Deferred Prosecution Agreement
Received and Filed. Plea Questionnaire/ Waiver of Rights

Motion Hearing exhibits from 09-09-2022 inventoried on this date.
Location: 791

Defendant Joseph M Standish in court.  Attorney Benjamin T Van Severen in court for Joseph M Standish.  Attorney Jon R Josephsen Jr. in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for Motion Hearing. Court ordered witnesses sequestered. Sworn for the state: City of West Allis police officer Allison Clark. Sworn for the state: City of West Allis police officer Lane Olson. Exhibit 1 received.  Exhibit list received and filed. Court held Colloquy with defendant regarding his right to testify.  Defendant knowingly and willingly WAIVED his  right to testify. Arguments heard. Court placed on the record, findings of fact and legal analysis. For reasons stated on the record, the Court DENIED the defense motion to suppress. Case adjourned to Branch 16.
Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for September 28, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Received and Filed. STATES RESPONSE MOTION

Defendant Joseph M Standish in court with attorney Benjamin T Van Severen.  Patrick T. Franken appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense has filed a motion to suppress. Court sets the following deadlines:
- 07/15/2022: deadline for State to ensure that all discovery, with the exception of crime lab reports, has been turned over to defense.
- 08/15/2022: deadline for filing any motions.
- 09/02/2022: deadline for filing any responses to any motions filed.
Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04, parties are hereby notified that effective 7/30/22, this case is assigned to branch 9, Judge Paul Van Grunsven in room 632 of the Courthouse. Defense has filed a substitution request, Court grants substitution. Case to be reassigned to Judge Grayson. Case is adjourned in Branch 16.  Evidentiary hearing scheduled for September 9, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Notice of Motion and Motion to Suppress
Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription and no dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Stark, Branch 17.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for scheduling conference in branch 17.
Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Case adjourned to Br. 17.

Defendant Joseph M Standish in court with attorney Benjamin T Van Severen.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Stark, Branch 17.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant plead not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 30, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Amount: $20.00
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 06/03/2022@2p
